description.narrative: Tanzania Youth Alliance is using Information Communication Technology (ICT) for health promotion and education program as a powerful tool for disease prevention and the reduction of health care costs. TAYOA is implementing 117 National Toll free Health Hel pline Services and 15017 Health SMS helpline Information project. In scalling up the Health AIDS Helpline and the SMS helpline TAYOA proposes to build on the ground work and existing infrastructure to strengthen the national AIDS Helpline services and cont inue to expand ICT oriented communication channels to SMS for Health related MDGs. This project is particularly opportunity for general Health Education and HIV/AIDS prevention given the rapid growth of mobile phones in urban and rural areas.The main objec tives of the project are: to develop and distribute SMS subscription forms to specific groups as well as general population who are potential users of ICTs services, to develop and disseminate SMS addressing reduction of child mortality improve martenal he alth and promote gender equality HIV prevention care and treatment, to contribute to health related MDGs in National Multi-Sectoral Framework and MKUKUTA by scaling up 117 Health helpline on access to preventive services through SMS.The following activit ies will be implemented: develop 20 000 SMS forms with 10 phone numbers capturing up to 200 000 subscribers, place 250 indoor SMS promotion boards in classrooms hostels targeting 15 000 students at higher learning institutions, promote SMS registeration pr ocess through 5 000 posters 20 billboards and 100 community events,develop SMS strategic design, make SMS structural design, conduct SMS development pretesting revision and production, hire 2 SMS helpline staff who will maintain SMS 12 hours operational, c reate database and share at least 200 short messages, conduct SMS impact Evaluation and develop sustainability through planning for continuity adjust to changing conditions and plan for continuity and self sufficiency.
